com.kamontat.utilities

Class HtmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kamontat.utilities.HtmlUtil

  • public class HtmlUtil
extends Object
    html conversion by Jsoup library
    All method is static method and The output, can managing by newOutputSetting(Document.OutputSettings)

    The easiest way to convert Element, Elements to String is toString() method

    Since:
    Mon 27/Mar/2017 - 11:49 PM
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    kamontat

      static org.jsoup.nodes.Element coverTag(String html, String... tagNames)
      cover html by tagNames by first element of tagName will be outermost.

      remove top tag and return as string
      The output, can managing by newOutputSetting(Document.OutputSettings)
      static String removeTag(String html)
      remove top tag and return as string

      insert html tag in the top
      Beware: It's include head and body tag too
      static org.jsoup.nodes.Element toHtmlByPlain(String plainText)
      same work with toHtmlByHtml(String) but think input parameter as plain text (so meaning if there have charactor that cannot convert to html it's will change to other)

      • newOutputSetting

        public static void newOutputSetting(org.jsoup.nodes.Document.OutputSettings setting)
        setting new output.
        Parameters:
        setting - Document.OutputSettings
        See Also:
        Document.OutputSettings

      • getHtmlInTag

        public static org.jsoup.select.Elements getHtmlInTag(String html,
                                                     String tag)
        get html tag include tag too 
        
 input (html): <div><code>Hello world</code>!</div>
 input (tag): code

 output: <code>Hello world</code>
        so you can remove the input tag by using removeTag(String)
        Parameters:
        html - searching html
        tag - tagName (learn more Tag.valueOf(String))
        Returns:
        Elements (which contains of html string inside tag parameter)
        See Also:
        removeTag(String)

      • removeTag

        public static String removeTag(String html)
        remove top tag and return as string 
        
  input: <div>I am <code>Java</code> programmer</div>
  output: I am <code>Java</code> programmer
        The output, can managing by newOutputSetting(Document.OutputSettings)
        Parameters:
        html - input html
        Returns:
        string that removed top tag

      • removeTag

        public static String removeTag(org.jsoup.select.Elements html)
        remove top tag and return as string
        The output, can managing by newOutputSetting(Document.OutputSettings)
        Parameters:
        html - input Elements (easy get from getHtmlInTag(String, String))
        Returns:
        string that removed top tag
        See Also:
        removeTag(String)

      • toHtmlByHtml

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Element toHtmlByHtml(String html)
        insert html tag in the top
        Beware: It's include head and body tag too 
        
 input: <div>I am <code>Java</code> programmer</div>
 output:
 <html>
      <head></head>
      <body>
          <div>I am <code>Java</code> programmer</div>
      </body>
 </html>
        The output, can managing by newOutputSetting(Document.OutputSettings)
        Parameters:
        html - input html
        Returns:
        input with html, body and head tag

      • toHtmlByPlain

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Element toHtmlByPlain(String plainText)
        same work with toHtmlByHtml(String) but think input parameter as plain text (so meaning if there have charactor that cannot convert to html it's will change to other)
        Example: 
        
 input: <div>I am <code>Java</code> programmer</div>
 output:
 <html>
      <head></head>
      <body>
          &lt;div&gt;I am &lt;code&gt;Java&lt;/code&gt; programmer&lt;/div&gt;
      </body>
 </html>
        Parameters:
        plainText - plain text
        Returns:
        input with html, body and head tag

      • coverTag

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Element coverTag(String html,
                                               String... tagNames)
        cover html by tagNames by first element of tagName will be outermost. 
        
  input (html): hello world
  input (tags): [html, body, div]

  output:
  <html>
      <body>
          <div>hello world</div>
      </body>
  </html>
        Parameters:
        html - input html
        tagNames - multiple tags name
        Returns:
        element that covered by those tags

      • parse

        public static org.jsoup.nodes.Document parse(String html)
        convert html String to Document (A lot more easier to manage it)
        Parameters:
        html - input html
        Returns:
        Document (include html body and head Tag)
        See Also:
        Document, Document.head(), Document.body()

      • addTag

        private static org.jsoup.nodes.Element addTag(String fullHtml,
                                              String tagName)

      • addTag

        private static org.jsoup.nodes.Element addTag(org.jsoup.nodes.Element e,
                                              String tagName)
